sub_topic: Identifying the isomorphism between two graphs.
message_1: Two graphs are given: Graph A and Graph B. Graph A has 5 vertices and 6 edges while Graph B has 6 vertices and 7 edges. Determine if Graph A and Graph B are isomorphic. If they are isomorphic, provide the isomorphism (a one-to-one correspondence that preserves the adjacency of the vertices) between the two graphs.
message_2:
To determine if Graph A and Graph B are isomorphic, we need to check if there is a one-to-one correspondence between their vertices that preserves the adjacency of the vertices. Since Graph A has 5 vertices and Graph B has 6 vertices, there cannot be a one-to-one correspondence between their vertices. 

Therefore, Graph A and Graph B are not isomorphic.
